The platform's front-line content moderation staff experienced the least impact, said Roth. Staff in engineering, communications, product, content curation and machine learning ethics were among those impacted by the layoffs. The company's entire human rights team was also cut.

348.title: Mahanagar Gas hikes CNG, PNG prices, auto gas rate up by ₹3.5/kg
348.article_body: The Mahanagar Gas Limited (MGL) has revised the prices of piped natural gas (PNG) and compressed natural gas (CNG) as it raised the auto gas price by ₹3.5/kg. The piped cooking gas price has been hiked by ₹1.5/standard cubic metre from Saturday midnight in Mumbai and adjoining areas. CNG price in Mumbai is ₹86/kg and the PNG price is ₹24.65/kg.

349.title: 18-year-old boy dies after bus rams into bike at Pune's Katraj Ghat
349.article_body: An 18-year-old boy was killed and another person was injured after a bus coming from the opposite direction rammed into the bike the duo was travelling on at Pune's Katraj Ghat on Friday, according to the police. Senior officials from a police station had rushed to the spot. "We have lodged...complaint," a senior inspector at the police station said.

350.title: No choice when Twitter is losing over $4 million per day: Elon Musk on layoffs
350.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said there was no choice other than to reduce Twitter's workforce as the company is losing more than $4 million per day. The company fired 50% of its workforce on Friday, a week after Musk took over control. "Everyone exited was offered 3 months of severance, which is 50% more than legally required," he said.

351.title: Volkswagen asks its brands to halt paid advertising on Twitter
351.article_body: The Volkswagen Group has asked its brands, which include Volkswagen, Seat, Cupra, Audi, Lamborghini, Bentley, Ducati and Porsche, to pause paid advertising on Twitter. This comes after several brands paused paid advertising on the platform following Elon Musk's takeover. "We are closely monitoring the situation and will decide about next steps depending on its evolvement," Volkswagen said.

352.title: Schumacher’s 2003 title-winning Ferrari could fetch ₹77 crore: Sotheby’s
352.article_body: Seven-time F1 world champion Michael Schumacher's 2003 championship-winning Ferrari car is being auctioned next week in Geneva. The red "Chassis 229" Ferrari raced by Schumacher nine times could reportedly fetch up to $9.4 million (₹77.16 crore). "It's...special because this car is one of the only four cars with more than four wins in Ferrari history," said auction house Sotheby's.

353.title: US announces new military aid for Ukraine worth $400 million
353.article_body: The US on Friday announced its latest military assistance package for Ukraine worth $400 million. The package will include the US paying for the refurbishment of 45 T-72 tanks from the Czech Republic for use by Kyiv, Pentagon spokeswoman Sabrina Singh told reporters. Pentagon said the US would also fund the refurbishment of some HAWK air defence missiles.

354.title: He was upset at not being selected in India's T20 WC squad: Shami's coach
354.article_body: Mohammad Shami's coach Mohammad Badruddin revealed that the India pacer was angry at not being selected for T20 World Cup. "Those pitches suit his bowling. He was upset when the selection didn't happen but never showed it...it [was] my gut feeling that he would play," said Badruddin. Shami was brought in as a replacement after Jasprit Bumrah was ruled out.

355.title: Tokyo Olympics bronze changed Indian hockey's face: Defender Rohidas
355.article_body: India defender Amit Rohidas said the team's historic bronze medal-winning feat at the Tokyo Olympics has changed the face of hockey in the country. "Youngsters who didn't play hockey earlier have now taken to the sport in the villages...it makes me feel very good," said Rohidas. He added that kids are eagerly waiting for the 2023 FIH men's World Cup.

356.title: Well thought out conspiracy: Pak leader on attack on Imran Khan
356.article_body: Senior leader of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party Fawad Chaudhry on Friday said the assassination attempt on party chief Imran Khan was "a prelude to a well-thought-out conspiracy". Chaudhry alleged three senior officials in Pakistan's federal government, Shehbaz Sharif, Rana Sanaullah and Major General Faisal Naseer, were "masterminds" of the attack on the former prime minister.

357.title: It's been a long time, can't wait to perform in India: WWE's Bayley
357.article_body: WWE wrestler Bayley said she can't wait for WWE to come back to India. "I know it's been a really long time and I always see their posts...I appreciate your guys' support and I can't wait to come perform for you one day," said Bayley. She will next be competing in a WWE Crown Jewel Championship match against Bianca Belair.

358.title: Iran commemorates 1979 US Embassy takeover
358.article_body: Iran on Friday commemorated the 1979 takeover of the American Embassy in Tehran. State-run television showed people in the capital waving placards with anti-American slogans and some waving triangle-shaped miniature drone-replicas, which suggested the use of Iranian drones by Russia in the Ukraine war. The commemorations were held as anti-government protests continued in parts of the country.

359.title: Britannia's Q2 net profit rises 28% YoY to ₹490 cr, revenue jumps 21%
359.article_body: FMCG major Britannia Industries reported a 28% year-over-year growth in consolidated net profit at ₹490.58 crore for the quarter ended September 2022. During the same quarter last fiscal, net profit stood at ₹381.8 crore. The company's revenue from operations jumped 21% year-over-year to ₹4,379.61 crore from ₹3,607.37 crore. Britannia's direct distribution jumped to 26 lakh outlets.

360.title: Civilians should be evacuated from conflict zones: Russian Prez
360.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said civilians should be evacuated from conflict areas in Kherson. On the occasion of Russia's Day of National Unity, Putin said the civilian population should not suffer. Kherson is one of the four Ukrainian provinces that Russia annexed in September. Putin added 3,18,000 people were drafted into the Army after the mobilisation exercise began.

361.title: Face ED, don't play tribal card: BJP leader to Jharkhand CM Soren
361.article_body: Senior BJP leader Babulal Marandi said that Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren should face the investigation by the Enforcement Directorate instead of playing the tribal card. "If PM Narendra Modi can face SIT questioning while being the Gujarat CM, why can't CM Soren?" Marandi asked. Notably, ED had summoned CM Soren in a money laundering case linked to alleged illegal mining.

362.title: What different do we get from other teams? Roger Binny on claims that ICC favours India
362.article_body: BCCI President Roger Binny has responded to claims that ICC favours India. "Not fair. I don't think we are favoured by ICC. Everyone gets same treatment," he said. "What different do we get from other teams? India is a big powerhouse in cricket but we are all treated the same," he added.

363.title: Delhi court grants interim bail to Sushil Kumar till November 12 due to wife's health
363.article_body: A Delhi court on Friday granted interim bail to two-time Olympic medallist Sushil Kumar, who's the main accused in the murder of wrestler Sagar Dhankar, till November 12. Kumar was granted interim bail due to the medical condition of his wife and two minor children, the court said. The court asked Sushil to furnish a personal bond of ₹1 lakh.

364.title: Thank you from Imran Khan's sons: Ex-Pak PM's ex-wife to man who tackled his attacker
364.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan's ex-wife Jemima Goldsmith took to Twitter to react to the news of Imran being shot at during a rally. "The news we dread...Thank God he's okay. And thank you from his sons to the heroic man in the crowd who tackled the gunman," she wrote. A man named Ibtesaam reportedly caught the attacker.

365.title: Bail plea of businessman accused in Andaman rape case rejected
365.article_body: The Calcutta High Court (HC) on Friday dismissed the anticipatory bail application of Sandeep Singh, who is an accused in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands gang rape case in which top officials were named. Further, the police issued a lookout notice against the Port Blair-based businessman. The police earlier announced a reward of ₹1 lakh for information to arrest Singh.

366.title: China’s Xi calls for Russia-Ukraine peace talks
366.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday called for peace negotiations between Russia and Ukraine, as he warned of the possibility of a nuclear conflict. Xi made the comments as he interacted with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, who is on a one-day state visit to Beijing. "As influential powers, China and Germany should work together in times of change," Xi said.

367.title: I would be very excited to see India playing in FIFA World Cup: Cafu
367.article_body: Former Brazilian footballer Cafu said that he would be very excited to see India playing in the FIFA World Cup. "Since I have come to India now, I wish India get to play in WC," Cafu said. During his India visit, the Brazilian ex-footballer will feature in an 'All Star' exhibition match along with Indian tennis legend Leander Paes.

368.title: SC denies relief to accused in Telangana MLAs poaching case
368.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday denied interim relief to the three arrested persons who allegedly tried to poach Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) legislators. On October 26, police registered an FIR against three persons for allegedly trying to lure four BRS legislators into defecting. The BRS has claimed that the arrested persons were working at the behest of the BJP.

369.title: 3 Military Engineer Services officials arrested in bribery case
369.article_body: Three officials working at the Military Engineer Services in Bhopal were arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹1.10 lakh. The accused were identified as Junior Administrative Assistant Arun Singh, Assistant Garrison Engineers JJ Kennedy and RS Yadav. The CBI said during searches at the residences of the arrested incriminating documents were found.

370.title: MS Dhoni moves Madras High Court for contempt proceedings against IPS officer
370.article_body: Ex-India captain MS Dhoni has moved Madras High Court to initiate contempt proceedings against IPS officer G Sampath Kumar for his alleged statements against Supreme Court and certain senior counsels. In his plea, Dhoni said Sampath had made the "defamatory remarks" in his written submissions in a case pertaining to IPL 2013 spot-fixing scandal. Sampath had investigated the scandal.

371.title: Forest official injured in crocodile attack during rescue op in UP
371.article_body: A forest official was injured when a crocodile attacked a team of forest officers carrying out an operation to rescue the reptile in UP's Sitapur. The crocodile bit the official's hand, District Forest Officer Mohan Shukla informed. Shukla said they had received information about a crocodile coming out of a lake, following which they reached the spot.

372.title: Probe agency has no right to ask accused for passwords: Delhi court
372.article_body: A Delhi court has ruled that an accused cannot be compelled by an investigation agency to share the password of his electronic devices. "Not only does an accused person has the right to refuse to answer...there is also a rule against adverse inferences being drawn," said the judge. The CBI had filed a case seeking the password of an accused.

373.title: Don't let people below 21 yrs buy liquor: Bilaspur SP to shop operators
373.article_body: Bilaspur Superintendent of Police (SP) Parul Mathur has asked liquor shop operators in the district to not sell liquors to people below 21 years of age and also prohibit their entry to bar shops. In a letter to the operators, Mathur said the shops should be opened after 12 pm and should be closed by 12 am at any cost.

374.title: 2nd airport near Chennai is 'need of the hour': Tamil Nadu govt
374.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government said on Friday that the proposed ₹20,000-crore airport at Parandur near Chennai would help the state achieve its '$1-trillion economy' target. The government said the second airport near Chennai was the "need of the hour", as there was congestion in the Meenambakkam airport. It added that cargo transactions were being shifted to Bengaluru and Hyderabad airports.

375.title: RIL appoints KV Kamath as independent director for 5 years
375.article_body: Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) on Friday appointed veteran banker KV Kamath as an independent director on the company board for a period of five years. Further, Kamath was also appointed as non-executive chairman of Reliance Strategic Investments Limited (RSIL), a wholly owned subsidiary of RIL. RSIL will be renamed as Jio Financial Services Limited (JFSL), the board announced.

376.title: Brazil are no more dependent on Neymar: Ex-player Cafu
376.article_body: Ex-footballer Cafu said that the Brazilian national team are no more dependent on forward Neymar, especially for the upcoming FIFA World Cup in Qatar. "Now Brazil isn't dependent...because there are several players like Vinicius Junior, Rodrygo, Richarlison and Lucas Paqueta...Those players are also capable of winning the cup...but four years ago, it was all Neymar," Cafu said.

377.title: Dogecoin falls 10% amid reports of Twitter pausing crypto wallet plans
377.article_body: Dogecoin's value recently dropped around 10% amid reports that Twitter is pausing its crypto wallet plans. "A recently revealed plan to build a crypto wallet for Twitter appears to be on pause," a report by Platformer revealed. Notably, the meme-based cryptocurrency's value nearly doubled after billionaire Elon Musk acquired Twitter last week.

378.title: Sudhir Suri's assailant runs garment shop, shot him with licensed revolver: Punjab DGP
378.article_body: Sandeep Singh, the assailant of Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri, runs a garment shop right in front of the site, where Suri was protesting with other Sena leaders, Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav, said. A scuffle broke out between them when he asked the leaders to stop the demonstration, following which he shot at Suri with his licensed gun, Yadav added.

379.title: Spent long time being secondary to men, now women need to have agency: Priyanka
379.article_body: Priyanka Chopra Jonas said she has spent a long time in her career where women have always been secondary to men. "The heroes decide where the movie is shot, who is cast, and what's happening. It is boring," she said. "We are living in a time where women need to be able to have agency in their lives," she added.

380.title: BJP chief JP Nadda holds roadshow in Shimla for Himachal elections
380.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Friday held a roadshow in Shimla for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. While addressing the public, he said, "This election is the election of protection of your rights." He told the public that they've to decide if they want to elect those who've done nothing for them or those who fight for their interests.

381.title: Soren has a lot to hide: BJP on Jharkhand CM seeking time from ED
381.article_body: After Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren sought three weeks time to appear before ED for questioning in a money laundering case, BJP spokesperson Pratul Shah Deo criticised him. He said Soren has a lot to hide because of which he is evading ED summons. "CM Soren is holding a constitutional post, hence he should...be cooperating with the investigating agency," he added.

382.title: Lesson on India's first woman Muslim teacher introduced in Andhra schools
382.article_body: The Andhra Pradesh government has introduced a lesson on Fatima Sheikh, believed to be India's first woman Muslim teacher, in the textbooks of eighth class. AP United Teachers' Federation leader D Ramu hailed the initiative. Sheikh is believed to have pioneered girls' education in India along with Savitribai Phule. Earlier, Maharashtra introduced a lesson on the reformer in school curriculum.

383.title: Public transport should be sustainable, affordable & accessible: Kerala CM
383.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Friday said public transport has to be sustainable, accessible, equitable and affordable and the government was working towards that purpose. Addressing the '15th Urban Mobility India (UMI) Conference and Expo', Vijayan said, "Kerala is the right place to host this conference as we're the second most-urbanised state with 47.7% of...population living in urban areas."

384.title: Varun brought out a side in me that I didn't know existed: Co-star Janhvi
384.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor, sharing her experience of working with Varun Dhawan in the upcoming film 'Bawaal', said, "I had a blast with Varun." Calling the actor a "bundle of energy", she said, "He brought out a side in me which I didn't know existed." Janhvi further said Varun advised her to take up "more commercial and massy films".

385.title: 2 boys dance before bus to make Insta reel in Chennai, get punishment
385.article_body: A video showing two teenage boys blocking a Metropolitan Transport Corporation bus and dancing in front of it in Chennai while making an Instagram reel has surfaced online. Following the incident, police made them spread road safety awareness at the same spot for three days as punishment. Another boy, who recorded the video, was also punished.

386.title: Delhi logs 54 fresh COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths in 24 hours
386.article_body: Delhi recorded 54 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 1.22% in the last 24 hours, as per data shared by the city health department on Friday. The national capital also reported two deaths due to the infection. The city's active case count now stands at 293. With the new cases, Delhi's total case tally has reached 20,06,443.

387.title: Why bother with how we collect party funds: Karnataka Cong to BJP
387.article_body: The Karnataka Congress has asked the BJP why it was bothered about the party collecting funds from its candidates. The Congress had announced that those aspiring for an Assembly ticket would have to buy a form for ₹5,000 and general category candidates would have to pay ₹2 lakh. The party said no leader has expressed displeasure over the fund collection.

388.title: Audible offers 2 months of free listening, offer ends soon
388.article_body: Audible, a destination for audio storytelling is running a limited period 2-month trial offer that gives customers access to thousands of audiobooks, podcasts and Audible Originals. From access to titles by leading authors such as Amish Tripathi to podcasts and originals voiced by Indian and international celebrities, this offer truly packs a punch, stated the brand.

389.title: I spent a lot of money: Boney on launching brothers Anil and Sanjay Kapoor
389.article_body: Film producer Boney Kapoor has said he "didn't leave any stone unturned" and spent a lot of money when he launched his brothers, Anil Kapoor and Sanjay Kapoor. Asked why he avoided producing the debut films of his own kids Arjun, Janhvi and Khushi, Boney said, "I decided someone else should launch [them]...I'll invest...as per their market value once they're...set."

390.title: Govt official found hanging at his residence in Jharkhand's Bokaro
390.article_body: A government official was found hanging at his residence in Jharkhand's Bokaro town on Thursday, police said. District Panchayat Raj Officer Raj Shekhar's body was found by his wife after she returned from her morning walk, police added. An investigation is underway to ascertain the cause of the death, which is suspected to be suicide, an official informed.

391.title: In our culture, everybody is roaming around to give advice to players: Akram
391.article_body: Ex-Pakistan skipper Wasim Akram said that current Pakistani cricketers are "big boys" and they know what they are doing. "I am usually not in favour of giving advice because, in our culture, everybody is roaming around to give their advice to cricketers," Akram said. He added, "You won't ask for advice still they will give it."

392.title: Arvind Kejriwal has gold medal in promising freebies: Hardeep Puri
392.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Puri criticised Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for playing "revdi politics", saying the AAP leader has a "gold medal" in promising freebies. "He will say make the Metro totally free...Luckily, Mr Kejriwal doesn't have to run the Metro," said Puri. The minister added that he would prefer to live in "green Kerala" due to the pollution in Delhi.

393.title: US adds 2,61,000 jobs in October, unemployment rises to 3.7%
393.article_body: US Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that total nonfarm payroll employment increased by 2,61,000 in October, and the unemployment rate rose to 3.7%. The number of unemployed persons increased by 3,06,000 to 6.1 million. The jobless rates for adult men, teenagers, Blacks, Asians and Hispanics showed little or no change over the month, the report added.

394.title: AAP lacks intent or policy to handle stubble burning: Haryana minister
394.article_body: Haryana Agriculture Minister JP Dalal said AAP leaders in Delhi and Punjab are indulging in a blame game instead of finding a solution to stubble burning. "It is a matter of right intent, right policy and management," said Dalal, adding that AAP leaders in Delhi and Punjab lack these. He added that pollution from Punjab is "impacting Haryana" as well.

395.title: What is the latest semi-final qualification scenario for T20 WC 2022 Super 12 Group 1?
395.article_body: From Super 12 Group 1, New Zealand have qualified for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals, while Afghanistan, Ireland and Sri Lanka have been eliminated from the race. England-Sri Lanka match will decide which team out of England and Australia will advance to semi-finals. England will reach semi-finals if they beat Sri Lanka, while Australia will advance if England lose.

396.title: Twitter has had a massive drop in revenue, says Elon Musk
396.article_body: Elon Musk, the new owner of Twitter, has tweeted that the micro-blogging platform has suffered a massive drop in revenue. He said it's "due to activist groups pressuring advertisers, even though nothing has changed with content moderation and we did everything we could to appease the activists". "Extremely messed up! They're trying to destroy free speech in America," Musk wrote.

397.title: 8-month pregnant Twitter employee locked out of company laptop night before layoffs began
397.article_body: An eight-month pregnant Twitter employee took to the microblogging platform to share that she was locked out of her company laptop the night before layoffs began on Friday. "Last Thursday in...SF office...really the last day Twitter was Twitter. 8 months pregnant and have a 9 month old. Just got cut off from laptop access #LoveWhereYouWorked," she wrote, sharing a picture.

398.title: Vivek Agnihotri teams up with 'Pushpa' director Sukumar for a film
398.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri and 'Pushpa' director Sukumar are teaming up for a film. Vivek took to Twitter to share the news, writing, "Uniting India with cinema. Details soon." The upcoming project will be produced by Abhishek Agarwal, who has bankrolled films like 'The Kashmir Files' and 'Karthikeya 2'.

399.title: 100 al-Shabab members killed in clashes with Somali forces: Somalia
399.article_body: Somalia's Defence Ministry on Friday said its forces and their allies on Thursday killed at least 100 al-Shabab fighters during clashes in Hiran province. The surrounding areas of one of the villages where the clashes took place have been seized by the government, the ministry added. Notably, al-Shabab claimed responsibility for two car explosions in Mogadishu last week.

400.title: CBI inspects ₹1 crore lottery won by TMC leader Anubrata Mondal
400.article_body: CBI officials on Friday visited a lottery shop in West Bengal where TMC leader Anubrata Mondal bought a lottery ticket, which fetched him ₹1 crore. The officials sought details about the ticket from the shop's owner and employees. An official said the agency suspects the black money earned from the West Bengal cattle smuggling scam was used in lottery business.

401.title: CM Shinde not capable of getting big projects to Maha: NCP's Ajit Pawar
401.article_body: NCP leader Ajit Pawar on Friday criticised the Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government and claimed that projects had moved away from the state due to "inefficiency" of the government. "As long as this government is in power, unemployment will only grow," Pawar said. He further alleged that many leaders from the NCP were being offered inducements to leave the party.

402.title: Gold worth ₹46.24 lakh found hidden in trolley lining at Chennai airport
402.article_body: Customs officials at Chennai airport on Thursday seized 1,038 gm gold worth ₹46.24 lakh concealed in the outer lining of a trolley suitcase allegedly belonging to a passenger from Sri Lanka. A video shared by the customs department shows the bag being cut open to reveal a string made of gold that was sewn into the lining of the bag.

403.title: FSDA conducts raid on unit making fake medicines in UP, 2 arrested
403.article_body: The Food Safety and Drug Administration (FSDA) department conducted a raid on a manufacturing unit involved in making fake Ayurvedic and Allopathic medicines in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal and two persons were arrested, police said. The accused were identified as Tej Prakash and Shubham. Fake Ayurvedic and Allopathic medicines worth over ₹1 crore along with a machine were recovered, police added.

404.title: Bhagyashree's husband undergoes 'major' surgery, actress shares update
404.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree, in an Instagram post on Thursday, revealed that her husband Himalay Dassani has been admitted to a Mumbai hospital where he has undergone shoulder surgery. She added that the "major surgery" took close to 4.5 hours. "The reason for sharing this is for people to understand that...even in...surgery this big, recovery can be smooth and fast," said Bhagyashree.
